Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Dist. No. 5 - #1 -- Prop.#1- Annual Service Chrg - BOC - 7 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 1 
(SERVICE CHARGE)

SUMMARY:  AN ANNUAL SERVICE CHARGE NOT TO EXCEED $50.00 PER YEAR ON EACH RESIDENTIAL AND COMMERCIAL STRUCTURE BEGINNING IN 2008, PROCEEDS TO BE USED FOR FIRE PROTECTION FOR CADDO PARISH FIRE DISTRICT NUMBER FIVE, INCLUDING EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES, ACQUIRING, CONSTRUCTING, MAINTAINING AND OPERATING FIRE PROTECTION FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT IN AND FOR THE DISTRICT, INCLUDING PAYING THE COST OF OBTAINING WATER FOR FIRE PROTECTION PURPOSES AND SALARIES OF FIREMEN AND ALL PURPOSES INCIDENTAL THERETO.
Race.FullText: Shall Caddo Parish Fire District Number Five, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an additional annual service charge not to exceed fifty dollars ($50.00) on each residential dwelling and commercial structure subject to taxation within the District pursuant to La. R. S. 40:1502.1, excluding that property annexed by the City of Shreveport prior to the election, for a period of seven (7) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2014 (an estimated $71,700 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the service charge for an entire year), for the purposes of fire protection, including emergency medical services, acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen and all purposes incidental thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Dist. No. 5 - #2 -- Prop.#2- $2,500,000 Gen.Obl.Bond-BOC-20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 2
(BONDS)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR CADDO PARISH FIRE DISTRICT NUMBER FIVE TO ISSUE UP TO $2,500,000 OF 20-YEAR GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS FOR THE PURPOSE OF (I) REFUNDING THE DISTRICT'S OUTSTANDING LIMITED TAX CERTIFICATES, SERIES 2007 AND (II) ACQUIRING BUILDINGS, MACHINERY AND EQUIPMENT, INCLUDING BOTH REAL AND PERSONAL PROPERTY, TO BE USED IN GIVING FIRE PROTECTION TO THE PROPERTY IN THE DISTRICT, TITLE TO WHICH SHALL BE IN THE PUBLIC.
Race.FullText: Shall Caddo Parish Fire District Number Five, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Two Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($2,500,000), to run twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of (i) refunding the District's outstanding Limited Tax Certificates, Series 2007 and (ii) acquiring buildings, machinery and equipment, including both real and personal property, to be used in giving fire protection to the property in the District, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto?
